business.headline: Sensex, Nifty fall for 4th straight session. Will stock market decline further? The Sensex hit an intraday low of 76,535.24 in early trade, and was down 437.23 points to 76,941.68 at around 11:22 am. At the same time, the Nifty50 was trading 161.85 points lower at 23,269.65.

Budget 2025: Government may raise minimum EPS pension to Rs 7,500The government might consider raising the minimum EPS pension to Rs 7,500, potentially bringing long-awaited relief to retirees in Budget 2025.

Adani Wilmar share price falls 8% to hit 52-week low. Here's why Adani Wilmar stock: Market cap of Adani Wilmar stood at Rs 35,494.22 crore. The stock has fallen 15.88% in the past week, 18.31% in the last 6 months, and 24.94% in the past year.

Rupee hits all-time low of 86/USD for first time. Will it decline further?The rupee slipped 0.4% to a record low of 86.39 per dollar. Check the key factors behind this decline and whether the Indian currency faces further challenges.

Standard Glass Lining IPO lists at 23% premium over IPO price on Dalal Street Standard Glass Lining listing: Shares listed at Rs 172 per share on the NSE, marking a premium of 22.86% over the IPO price, which was set in the range of Rs 133 to Rs 140 per share.

Explained: Why Biocon share price climbed over 4% in early trade todayBiocon's share price climbed to an intraday high of Rs 377.50 per share in intraday trade on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). As of 10:23 am, Biocon's stock was trading at Rs 376.60 per share, up 4.34% on the BSE.

Budget 2025: Experts push for HRA inclusion, Rs 1 lakh standard deduction Amid rising costs and squeezed disposable incomes, the spotlight is on the new tax regime, with experts pushing the demands for HRA inclusion and a Rs 1 lakh standard deduction in Budget 2025.

Rupee falls to all-time low of 86 against US dollar, likely to remain volatileRupee hits all-time low: For the Indian economy, the sustained pressure on the rupee could translate to higher import costs and a potential rise in inflation.

Sensex falls over 600 points: Why is stock market down today? 3 key reasonsStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 657.97 points to 76,720.94, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 199.60 points to 23,231.90 as of 9:20 AM.

Stricter US sanctions threaten Russia's oil trade with India and China: Report The new sanctions are likely to severely affect Russia's oil exports, as many tankers previously used for shipments to India and China will now face restrictions.

Standard Glass Lining IPO listing: Shares to make strong market debut? Check GMPStandard Glass Lining share price: The IPO was open for subscription from January 6 to 8, offering shares in a price band of Rs 133-140 with a lot size of 107 shares.

Stocks to watch today: Adani Green Energy, Ola Electric, DMart, HCLTechKey stocks likely to be in focus include Adani Green Energy, Ola Electric, DMart, HCLTech, Angel One, and others due to various announcements, news updates, and quarterly results.

90-hour workweek: What India Inc thinks of L&T chief's suggestionL&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan recently expressed regret over not being able to make employees work on Sundays, suggesting that a 90-hour workweek is key to success.
Union Budget 2025: High hopes as dark clouds loom over economyAmid fears of an economic slowdown, here's what key sectors are demanding from Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in Union Budget 2025.
Will the stock market recover next week? 4 things you should knowGlobal headwinds and FII outflows weigh on the Sensex and Nifty. Will Dalal Street see a recovery next week after the turbulent run?

Explained: Why Infosys has filed counter lawsuit against CognizantInfosys vs Cognizant legal battle: The Bengaluru-based firm accused its US-based rival of contractually restricting clients from awarding IT services to competitors and withholding software training, which Infosys claims hindered its ability to compete.
High-return FD offers in 2025: SBI, IDBI, Indian Bank, and moreEnhance your savings in 2025 with FD schemes offering up to 8.05% interest, valid until March 31, 2025.

Supreme Court gives big relief for online gaming sector. Details hereThe Supreme Court has stayed Rs 1.12 lakh crore GST notices against online gaming firms, with a final hearing scheduled for March 18, 2025.

Industry leaders call for up to 90-hour workweek. Are they willing to pay more? L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan made waves by suggesting employees should work on Sundays. Last year, Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy proposed that millennials work 70-hour weeks to improve India's productivity.
Budget 2025: Don't expect these tax changesBudget 2025 is likely to prioritise fiscal discipline, minor tax tweaks, and cautious consumption boosts over bold reforms.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: You've dragged your feet: Court slams Delhi government for delaying CAG reportDragged your feet to avoid Assembly session: Court slams AAP government on delaying CAG report

Maha Kumbh Mela begins, luxury tents, 45 crore devotees, AI-enabled camerasThe 45-day Maha Kumbh, happening after a gap of 144 years, will witness the participation of over 45 crore devotees, including nearly 15 lakh from foreign nations.

Drugged, gang-raped, burned alive: 5 cases reveal horror of UK grooming gangsProbes by counties and reports in the media reveal how grooming gangs run by Pakistani-origin men brutally tortured and gang-raped white girls as young as 11 in the UK. In one case, the victim was burned alive with her sister and mother. Here are five cases that reveal the extent of horror of these grooming gangs in the UK.

Abhishek Sharma says IndiGo staff misbehaved at Delhi airport, ruined his holidayCricketer Abhishek Sharma lashed out at the popular airline, saying its staff misbehaved with him at the Delhi airport on Monday, January 13. Abhishek said he had only a day's holiday to spend with his close ones before he headed to Kolkata for the opening match of a T20I series against England.

How Yogi Adityanath is charting own course on Hindutva heritageThere are two streams of thought in the larger Hindutva family when it comes to the disputed places of worship. With his stance that "reclaiming heritage is not a bad thing", Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has charted a distinct course, different from RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat's.

Atishi raises over Rs 18 lakh from crowdfunding drive, to file nomination todayDelhi Chief Minister Atishi's crowdfunding campaign garnered support from 422 donors, with Rs 18.56 lakh raised so far.

24 dead, 12,000 structures destroyed in Los Angeles fire amid race to douse blazeFirefighters raced to control the wildfires in Los Angeles, which has claimed 24 lives so far. Additionally, 16 people have been reported missing amid the ongoing crisis.

Comet visible tonight: Next time it returns none of us will be on EarthDiscovered on April 5, 2024, by the Asteroid Terrestrial-impact Last Alert System (ATLAS) in Chile, G3 ATLAS was initially faint, shining at a magnitude of +19.

PM to launch Sonamarg tunnel in J&K today, Omar Abdullah says will boost tourismPM Modi will reach the Sonamarg Tunnel at 11.45 am for its inauguration. Built at a cost of Rs 2,700 crore, the tunnel will enable the development of Sonamarg resort in Ganderbal district as a winter sports destination.

China conducts drills near LAC in Eastern Ladakh, Indian forces on alert: SourcesHeaded by a regiment of the Chinese army's Xinjiang Military Command, the military exercise featured advanced military technology, including all-terrain vehicles, unmanned systems, drones, and exoskeletons designed to enhance soldier mobility and endurance.

As Trump threatens Canada, Trudeau ex-ally's warning: There will be price to payCanadian MP Jagmeet Singh denounced US President-elect Donald Trump's repeated remarks about Canada becoming America's "51st state."

Video: Los Angeles man's emotional reunion with dog feared lost amid wildfireA man's desperate days-long search for his beloved dog amid the chaos of the deadly Los Angeles wildfire had a happy ending, as Casey Colvin reunited with Oreo, the pet he feared lost.

Infra development in J&K unrelated to Article 370 scrapping: Omar AbdullahSpeaking to India Today TV, Chief Minister Omar Abdullah said that completion of infrastructure projects in Jammu and Kashmir has no connection to abrogation of Article 370, adding that they were bound to happen.

Former Fossils member Chandramouli Biswas found dead, suicide suspectedThe body of Chandramouli Biswas, former bassist of the band Fossils, was discovered in Kolkata. Police suspect suicide. The news deeply affected his former bandmates, with Rupam Islam and others paying tribute.

Dense fog warning issued for Delhi for next two days as coldwave grips capitalMeanwhile, the air quality in the Delhi-NCR region remained in the 'poor' category on Monday, recording an Air Quality Index (AQI) of 285.
Angry elephant chases man. 'Identify the animal' in the video, says IFS officerThe video shows the man repeatedly annoying the elephant, seemingly for amusement.

Video: Anushka Sharma returns solo after Alibaug trip with Virat KohliAnushka Sharma returned to Mumbai alone after a trip to Alibaug with Virat Kohli. The couple was earlier seen at the Gateway of India and Vrindavan.

India not doing well in Test cricket: New BCCI secretary vows to make changesNewly appointed BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia has vowed to help India return to their best shape in Test cricket. Saikia has acknowledged that India have dropped the ball in Tests in the recent times.

Man dressed as firefighter caught looting homes in Los Angeles amid deadly firesLos Angeles County Sheriff Robert Luna confirmed that at least 29 arrests were made on Sunday (January 12). Of these, 25 arrests occurred in the Eaton Fire area, while four were reported near the Palisades Fire region.

Tom had everything planned: Dominic Holland on his son's proposal to ZendayaHollywood actors Zendaya and Tom Holland are engaged. Tom's father, Dominic Holland, shared details of the well-planned proposal. The couple will soon star in Christopher Nolan's Odyssey.

Video: Bus conductor assaults retired IAS officer over Rs 10 fare in JaipurThe conductor assaulted the retired IAS officer as he refused to pay an additional fare of Rs 10 after he was not dropped at the correct bus stop.

Made traitors like him sit at home: Amit Shah's fiery attack on Uddhav ThackerayUnion Home Minister Amit Shah launched a blistering attack on Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray during the BJP's state executive meeting in Shirdi. He criticised Uddhav Thackeray for aligning with the Opposition for the Maharashtra Assembly polls.

After calling Gautam Gambhir hypocrite, Manoj Tiwary blames media for editingFormer India cricketer Manoj Tiwary has issued a clarification, days after calling Gautam Gambhir a hypocrite. Tiwary had lashed out at the India head coach after the team's loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Black Warrant review: Vikramaditya Motwane's show is real, raw and worth your timeReleased-Fri Jan 10, 2025Black Warrant is a prison drama based on a book of the same title. The Netflix series shows what happens inside Asia's biggest prison - Tihar Jail, and also comments on the judicial system in the country.

The Greatest Rivalry: Netflix's India vs Pakistan documentary to be out in FebruaryA new documentary series called The Greatest Rivalry: India vs Pakistan will be launched on Netflix, exploring the iconic cricket rivalry between the two countries.

BB 18 Day 97: Chaahat Pandey evicted days before grand finale Ahead of the much-anticipated grand finale of Bigg Boss 18, TV actor Chaahat Pandey was evicted from the reality TV show. The finale will air on January 19.

sports.headline: Karun Nair equals record-feat in Vijay Hazare in bid to revive India careerVijay Hazare Trophy: Vidarbha captain Karun Nair equalled the record of Narayan Jagadeesan by hitting his 5th century of the tournament. Nair has been in terrific form and is pushing hard to revive his dormant India career.

Barcelona coach hails 'incredible team' after Super Cup win vs Real MadridFC Barcelona manager Hansi Flick has praised his team after winning their first trophy of the season. Barcelona beat Real Madrid 5-2 in the Spanish Super Cup Final.

Karma hit me: Tsitsipas reflects on shock Australian Open first-round lossAustralian Open 2025: Former finalist Stefanos Tsitsipas lost to 20-year-old American Alex Michelsen in the first round of the season's first Grand Slam. Tsitsipas had withdrawn from doubles, hoping for a deep run in singles in Melbourne.

10-men Barcelona thrash Real Madrid 5-2 to win Spanish Super CupFC Barcelona players scored 4 goals in the first half to win their first title of the season. Barcelona beat Real Madrid 5-2 in the final of the Spanish Super Cup.

Pat Cummins to lead as Australia announce 15-member squad for Champions TrophyAustralia have announced their 15-member preliminary squad for the Champions Trophy. Injured fast bowlers Pat Cummins and Josh Hazlewood have been named in the side.

Shreyas Iyer sets sight on winning maiden title for Punjab Kings as captainThe newly appointed captain of the Punjab Kings, Shreyas Iyer, has set his sights on winning maiden title for the franchise in the upcoming IPL 2025.

FA Cup: 10-man Manchester United, Bayindir dump Arsenal out on penaltiesAltay Bayindir was the star of the show as 10-man Manchester United defeated Arsenal 5-3 on penalties to dump them out of the FA Cup in the third round on Sunday, January 12. United fought bravely for most of the game as Diogo Dalot was given a red card.

Watch: Aryna Sabalenka recreates viral TikTok dance with Melbourne crowdAryna Sabalenka recreated one of her viral TikTok videos with the Melbourne crowd after her first round win in the Australian Open 2025 on Sunday, January 12. Sabalenka defeated Sloanne Stephens in straight sets to make it to the second round.

IPL 2025: Shreyas Iyer to lead Punjab Kings as franchise aims to end barren runPunjab Kings announced India batter Shreyas Iyer as their captain for the Indian Premier League 2025(IPL 2025). Punjab bought Iyer for a whopping Rs 26.75 Crore during the mega auction.

Devajit Saikia delighted to carry forward work done by Jay Shah as BCCI SecretaryThe newly elected BCCI Secretary Devajit Saikia said that he's delighted to carry forward the work done by his predecessor Jay Shah.

PD Champions Trophy: Indian Physical Disability Team beat Pakistan by 109 runsNikhil Manhas was the star of the show as the Indian physical disability team defeated Pakistan by 109 runs on Sunday, January 12. India posted 160 runs in their 19 overs as Pakistan's chase faltered in just 12.2 overs.

Watch: Mohammad Nawaz and Tanzim Hasan get involved in physical fight in BPLMohammad Nawaz and Tanzim Hasan Sakib were seen getting involved in a physical fight during Bangladesh Premier League Match 17 between Sylhet Strikers and Khulna Tigers.

Meanwhile, the Women's Premier League will feature matches in Lucknow, Mumbai, Baroda, and Bengaluru, showcasing a landmark season for women's cricket in India.

Jemimah's hundred helps India clinch ODI series with 116-run victory over IrelandJemimah Rodrigues' maiden international century powered India Women to their highest-ever ODI total of 370/5, securing a dominant 116-run victory over Ireland. With disciplined bowling, India clinched the series 2-0 with one game remaining.

Australian Open: Alexander Zverev breezes past Lucas Pouille to reach Round 2Alexander Zverev made light work of wildcard Lucas Pouille to reach the second round of the Australian Open 2025 on Sunday, January 12. Zverev defeated Pouille in straight sets to make it to the next round in Melbourne.

Afghanistan announce squad for Champions Trophy, Ghazanfar to play maiden ICC eventAfghanistan Cricket Board (ACB) have announced a 15-member squad for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. AM Ghazanfar is all set to play his maiden ICC tournament while Mujeeb ur Rahman has missed out on selection.

Watch: Glenn Maxwell smashes Will Sutherland for hat-trick of sixes in BBLMelbourne Stars captain Glenn Maxwell smashed a hat-trick of sixes against Will Sutherland during Match 32 of the Big Bash League 2024-25 against Melbourne Renegades.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
